defendant.name: J. Thompson
defendant.occupation: Finance Manager at Yorktown Municipal Office

details.behavior: During this period, J. Thompson transferred $50,000 from the Yorktown Municipal Office's disaster relief fund into a personal bank account held at Yorktown Federal Bank.
details.evidence: Bank statements showing the transfers, witness testimony from municipal office employees, and email correspondence between J. Thompson and bank officials.

details.behavior: J. Thompson authorized payments totaling $30,000 to a fictitious vendor, diverting funds intended for emergency rescue operations into a private business owned by an associate.
details.evidence: Invoices from the fictitious vendor, security footage showing Thompson authorizing payments, and confession from the associate.

details.behavior: On multiple occasions, J. Thompson used his position to withdraw an additional $20,000 from the flood control budget, which was again diverted for personal use.
details.evidence: Audit reports showing discrepancies, statement from the accounting department head, and physical evidence of unauthorized access to budget accounts.

judgmentResult.sentence: J. Thompson is sentenced to a fixed-term imprisonment of ten years and is ordered to pay restitution of the embezzled $100,000.
judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: Given the defendant's embezzlement of a large amount of public funds intended for disaster relief, the court deemed this as severe embezzlement, justifying a ten-year sentence. Probation is not applicable due to the serious nature of the crime.
